item.shortDesc: A range in the ulCodePageRange field cannot be validated because a code page is not installed
item.problem:
This message does not indicate there is an error in the font. To validate the codepage compliance of a font, all codepages covered by the font must be installed on the testing system.

To install additional codepages in Windows, do the following:
  1. Go to Control Panel.
  2. Choose Regional and Language Options.
  3. Click the Advanced tab.
  4. In the Codepage Conversion Tables list, select the codepages you wish to install. You will need to have your Windows installation disk available.

item.shortDesc: An exception occurred during rasterization testing
item.problem:
The rasterization testing cannot be continued due to an error in the font. Before completing rasterization testing, you will need to identify and fix this error, using details provided.

If exception errors continue after you have changed the font data, please contact the Microsoft Typography group.

item.shortDesc: Unexpected End of File
item.problem: ERROR: Required field missing

item.shortDesc: The file was not recognized as a valid OpenType font file
item.problem: The Validator did not find a valid 4-byte sfnt version label in the offset table. The allowable values are '0100' (font contains TrueType outlines), 'OTTO' (font contains CFF data), or 'ttcf' (TrueType Collection file).

item.shortDesc: Read error: offset exceeds length of the table
item.problem: ERROR: Required field missing

item.shortDesc: Error reading file
item.problem: ERROR: Required field missing

item.shortDesc: Font Validation was canceled by the user
item.problem: ERROR: Required field missing

item.shortDesc: The entrySelector field is invalid
item.problem: The value of the entrySelector field must equal Log2(maximum power of 2<=numTables). Regenerate this font.

item.shortDesc: The sfnt field is invalid
item.problem: The sfnt field may have a value of either 1.0 (indicating that TrueType outlines are in the font) or 'OTTO' (indicating CFF data is in the font). The Apple specification for TrueType fonts allows for 'true' and 'typ1' for sfnt version. These version tags should not be used for fonts which contain OpenType tables.

item.shortDesc: The numTables field is zero
item.problem: The numTables field must equal the number of tables in the font. At a minimum there are eight required tables in a TrueType font. Regenerate this font.

item.shortDesc: The rangeShift field is invalid
item.problem: The value of the rangeShift field must equal (numTables) x 16 - (searchRange). Regenerate this font.

item.shortDesc: The searchRange field is invalid
item.problem: The value of the searchRange field must equal (maximum power of 2<=numTables)x16. Regenerate this font.

item.shortDesc: Required table is missing
item.problem:
A minimum of eight tables are required in a valid TrueType font: cmap, head, hhea, hmtx, maxp, name, OS/2, and post.

If TrueType data is present in the font, then the following tables are also required: cvt, fpgm, glyf, loca, and prep. If CFF data is in the font, then both the CFF and VORG tables need to be present.

Microsoft also requires that the DSIG table be present in fonts delivered by vendors to Microsoft.

Microsoft further recommends that the gasp table be present in all fonts.To learn more about these recommendations, see the Hinting and Production Guidelines Specification.

item.shortDesc: Directory Entry checksum error
item.problem: This error indicates a structural problem with the font. Structural errors may be caused by: a font tool incorrectly generating the font file; a person altering the contents of a valid font file; or some other corruption to the font file. Regenerate the font, or contact the font vendor to obtain a valid version of the font.

item.shortDesc: Directory Entry contains a duplicate tag
item.problem: Each tag in the Table Directory refers to a single table, feature, or language within the font. All tag names used must be unique within the font.

item.shortDesc: Directory Entry length is 0
item.problem: This error indicates a structural problem with the font. Structural errors may be caused by: a font tool incorrectly generating the font file; a person altering the contents of a valid font file; or some other corruption to the font file. Regenerate the font, or contact the font vendor to obtain a valid version of the font.

item.shortDesc: The directory entry tag name is invalid
item.problem: All tag names consist of four characters. Names with less than four characters are allowed if followed by the necessary trailing spaces. All tag names defined within a font (including table names, feature tags, and language tags) must be composed of printing characters represented by ASCII values 32-126.

item.shortDesc: The directory entry tags are not in ascending order
item.problem: Entries in the table directory must be sorted in ascending order by tag name. Rebuild this font.

item.shortDesc: Directory Entry tag is 0
item.problem: All tag names consist of four characters. Names with less than four characters are allowed if followed by the necessary trailing spaces. All tag names defined within a font (including table names, feature tags, and language tags) must be composed of printing characters represented by ASCII values 32-126.

item.shortDesc: The data overlaps existing data
item.problem: This error indicates a structural problem with the font. Structural errors may be caused by: a font tool incorrectly generating the font file; a person altering the contents of a valid font file; or some other corruption to the font file. Regenerate the font, or contact the font vendor to obtain a valid version of the font.

item.shortDesc: An exception occurred preventing completion of table validation

item.problem: This error indicates a structural problem with the font. Structural errors may be caused by: a font tool incorrectly generating the font file; a person altering the contents of a valid font file; or some other corruption to the font file. Regenerate the font, or contact the font vendor to obtain a valid version of the font.

item.shortDesc: Cannot perform test, a needed table is missing!
item.problem: ERROR: Required field missing

item.shortDesc: A duplicate subtable was found
item.problem: Although cmap tables may include multiple subtables, duplicate subtables are unnecessary. Identify and remove the duplicate subtable, using a cmap editing tool.

item.shortDesc: The subtable is fmt 0, but the length is not 262
item.problem: A format 0 cmap subtable indicates the Apple standard character to glyph index mapping table, which maps only 256 characters. The total table length, including the glyphIDArray, should always be 262 bytes. This error indicates a structural problem with the font. Structural errors may be caused by: a font tool incorrectly generating the font file; a person altering the contents of a valid font file; or some other corruption to the font file. Regenerate the font, or contact the font vendor to obtain a valid version of the font.

item.shortDesc: The groups are not sorted by ascending startCharCode
item.problem: The ranges of character codes in a format 12 cmap subtable must be ordered by startCount (the starting character code of each range).

item.shortDesc: The startCharCode is greater than the endCharCode
item.problem: Each endCharCode must be greater in value than the startCharCode for that specific group of characters. A group's endCharCode must be less than the startCharCode of the following group (if any).

item.shortDesc: The endCode array is not in ascending order
item.problem: Due to the way arrays of character codes are searched, the endCode array in a format 4 cmap subtable must be in ascending order. Regenerate this font.

item.shortDesc: The entrySelector field does not equal the calculated value
item.problem: The entrySelector value in format 4 cmap subtables must equal log2(searchRange/2). Regenerate this font.

item.shortDesc: The final value in the endCode array is not 0xffff
item.problem: For a character code search to terminate properly, the final endCode value in each array must be 0xFFFF. At a minimum, a segment must include the single character code OxFFFF, which may be mapped to missingGlyph. Regenerate this font.

item.shortDesc: The idRangeOffset is 0 and idDelta + startCode is negative
item.problem: The idDelta value added to the character code offset should correspond to the mapped glyph index, when the idRangeOffset is 0. Regenerate this font.

item.shortDesc: The idRangeOffset indexes past the end of the subtable
item.problem: This error indicates a structural problem with the font. Structural errors may be caused by: a font tool incorrectly generating the font file; a person altering the contents of a valid font file; or some other corruption to the font file. Regenerate the font, or contact the font vendor to obtain a valid version of the font.

item.shortDesc: The rangeShift field does not equal the calculated value
item.problem: The rangeShift field must equal (2 * segCount - searchRange). Regenerate this font.

item.shortDesc: The reservedPad field is not 0
item.problem: The reservedPad field should have a value of 0. Regenerate this font.

item.shortDesc: The searchRange field does not equal the calculated value
item.problem: The searchRange value in format 4 cmap subtables must equal (2 * largest power of 2 <=segCount). Regenerate this font.

item.shortDesc: The segCountX2 field is not even
item.problem: The segCountX2 value must equal (2 * number of segments of contiguous ranges of character codes). Regenerate this font.

item.shortDesc: The startCode is greater than the endCode
item.problem: Each segment of contiguous character codes in format 4 cmap subtables are described by a startCode and endCode. The startCode should indicate the starting character code for each segment; the endCode should indicate the ending character code for each segment. The segments should be sorted in order of increasing endCode values.

item.shortDesc: A character maps to an invalid glyphID
item.problem: The glyphID referenced in the cmap subtable does not exist. The glyph may have been removed without the cmap being updated. To correct the problem, add the desired glyph to the font, then map the glyph to the proper character code using a cmap edit tool.

item.shortDesc: The subtable length points past the end of the table
item.problem: This error indicates a structural problem with the font. Structural errors may be caused by: a font tool incorrectly generating the font file; a person altering the contents of a valid font file; or some other corruption to the font file. Regenerate the font, or contact the font vendor to obtain a valid version of the font.

item.shortDesc: The subtable length is zero
item.problem: This error indicates a structural problem with the font. Structural errors may be caused by: a font tool incorrectly generating the font file; a person altering the contents of a valid font file; or some other corruption to the font file. Regenerate the font, or contact the font vendor to obtain a valid version of the font.

item.shortDesc: The subtable offset points past the end of the table
item.problem: This error indicates a structural problem with the font. Structural errors may be caused by: a font tool incorrectly generating the font file; a person altering the contents of a valid font file; or some other corruption to the font file. Regenerate the font, or contact the font vendor to obtain a valid version of the font.

item.shortDesc: The subtable offset is zero
item.problem: This error indicates a structural problem with the font. Structural errors may be caused by: a font tool incorrectly generating the font file; a person altering the contents of a valid font file; or some other corruption to the font file. Regenerate the font, or contact the font vendor to obtain a valid version of the font.

item.shortDesc: Overlapping subtables were found
item.problem: This error indicates a structural problem with the font. Structural errors may be caused by: a font tool incorrectly generating the font file; a person altering the contents of a valid font file; or some other corruption to the font file. Regenerate the font, or contact the font vendor to obtain a valid version of the font.

item.shortDesc: The subtables are not in the correct order
item.problem: The cmap subtables (and their header entries) must be sorted first by platform ID, then by platform-specific encoding ID, and then by the version field in the corresponding subtable. Regenerate this font.

item.shortDesc: The subtable's format number is invalid
item.problem: The valid cmap subtable formats are: 0 (byte encoding table); 2 (high-byte mapping through table); 4 (segment mapping to delta values); 6 (trimmed table mapping); 8 (mixed 16-bit and 32-bit coverage); 10 (trimmed array); and 12 (segmented coverage). Regenerate this font.

item.shortDesc: The table version number is not 0
item.problem: Version 0 is the only version of the cmap table currently defined. Correct this field using a table editing tool.

item.shortDesc: A non-mac subtable has a non-zero language value
item.problem: This field must be set to zero for all cmap subtables whose platform IDs are other than Macintosh (platform ID 1). Correct this field using a cmap editing tool.

item.shortDesc: The last endCharCode is greater than 0x10ffff
item.problem: ERROR: Required field missing

item.shortDesc: Illegal variation selector
item.problem: The set of legal variation selectors is U+E0100-U+E01EF and U+FE00-U+FE0F and

item.shortDesc: Variation Selectors not in ascendering order
item.problem: Variation Selector Records must be sorted in increasing order of 'varSelector'.

item.shortDesc: More than one record for a given variation selector
item.problem: No two records may have the same 'varSelector'.

item.shortDesc: Illegal Unicode code point value
item.problem: Unicode code points must be between U+0000 and U+10FFFF, inclusive

item.shortDesc: Default UVS table value ranges overlap or out of order
item.problem: The Unicode Value Ranges of a Default UVS Table must be sorted in increasing order of 'startUnicodeValue'. The ranges must not overlap, i.e., ('startUnicodeValue' + 'additionalCount') must be last than the 'startUnicodeValue' of the following range (if any).

item.shortDesc: Default UVS table startUnicodeValue + additionalCount greater than 0xFFFFFF
item.problem: The ('startUnicodeValue' + 'additionalCount') of a given Unicode Value Range of a Default UVS Table must not exceed 0xFFFFFF

item.shortDesc: Non-Default UVS table value ranges overlap or out of order
item.problem: The UVS Mappings of a Non-Default UVS Table must be sorted in increasing order of 'unicodeValue'. No two mappings in this table may have the same 'unicodeValue' values.

item.shortDesc: GlyphID in Non-Default UVS table greater than number of glyphs in the font
item.problem: A 'unicodeValue' in a UVS Mapping in a Non-Default UVS Table has been mapped to a glyphID that is greater than or equal to the number of glyphs in the font.

item.shortDesc: Default UVS table offset out of range of table
item.problem:
The offset to a Default UVS table is outside the bounds of the Format 14 subtable.

This error indicates a structural problem with the font. Structural errors may be caused by: a font tool incorrectly generating the font file; a person altering the contents of a valid font file; or some other corruption to the font file. Regenerate the font, or contact the font vendor to obtain a valid version of the font.

item.shortDesc: Non-Default UVS table offset out of range of table
item.problem:
The offset to a Non-Default UVS table is outside the bounds of the Format 14 subtable.

This error indicates a structural problem with the font. Structural errors may be caused by: a font tool incorrectly generating the font file; a person altering the contents of a valid font file; or some other corruption to the font file. Regenerate the font, or contact the font vendor to obtain a valid version of the font.

item.shortDesc: A name record specifies using the Unicode Variation Sequences cmap subtable (Format 14)
item.problem: Unicode platform ID 0, encoding ID 5 (Unicode Variation Sequences) can be used for encodings in the 'cmap' table but not for strings in the 'name' table.

item.shortDesc: Non-Default UVS table offset out of range of offset tables
item.problem:
The offset to a Non-Default UVS table is within the Format 14 header or variation selector records.

This error indicates a structural problem with the font. Structural errors may be caused by: a font tool incorrectly generating the font file; a person altering the contents of a valid font file; or some other corruption to the font file. Regenerate the font, or contact the font vendor to obtain a valid version of the font.

item.shortDesc: Default UVS table offset out of range of offset tables
item.problem:
The offset to a Default UVS table is within the Format 14 header or variation selector records.

This error indicates a structural problem with the font. Structural errors may be caused by: a font tool incorrectly generating the font file; a person altering the contents of a valid font file; or some other corruption to the font file. Regenerate the font, or contact the font vendor to obtain a valid version of the font.

item.shortDesc: Overlapping of Format 14 tables
item.problem:
Two tables overlap indicating corrupted data. The tables could be either non-default or default UVS tables or both.

This error indicates a structural problem with the font. Structural errors may be caused by: a font tool incorrectly generating the font file; a person altering the contents of a valid font file; or some other corruption to the font file. Regenerate the font, or contact the font vendor to obtain a valid version of the font.

item.shortDesc: The length of the cvt table is not an even number of bytes
item.problem: The length of the table must be an integral number of FWORD units. Recreate the cvt table using a hinting tool.

item.shortDesc: A signature block is not in format 1
item.problem: Version 1 (0x00000001) is the only version of the DSIG table currently defined. Correct this field using a table editing tool; or obtain a font signing tool that creates valid DSIG tables.

item.shortDesc: A signature block contains a reserved value that is not zero
item.problem: The two bytes at the beginning of each signature block are both reserved fields and should both be set to 0. Sign the font again using a tool that sets these bytes correctly.

item.shortDesc: The digital signature of the file did not verify
item.problem:
The digital signature is not valid, or the file does not match the digital signature. This may indicate that the contents of the font file were altered after the font was signed, or the signature is not current, or a non-matching DSIG table has been appended to the font.

Although the enforcement of signatures is an administrative policy issue, Microsoft recommends that, to promote file integrity, all fonts be digitally signed. Resign the font, or contact the font vendor for a valid version of the font.

item.shortDesc: The version is not 0x00020000
item.problem: Version 0x00020000 is the only version of the EBDT table currently defined. Correct this field using a table editing tool.

item.shortDesc: The EBLC table is not present
item.problem: ERROR: Required field missing

item.shortDesc: The glyph image data is invalid
item.problem: ERROR: Required field missing

item.shortDesc: the bitDepth field is not a valid value
item.problem: The Microsoft rasterizer v.1.7 or greater supports the following bitDepth values: 1 (black/white), 2 (4 levels of gray), 4 (16 levels of gray), and 8 (256 levels of gray). Change this value using a table editing tool or an embedded bitmap editor.

item.shortDesc: The indexSubTableArrayOffset field is not in a valid range
item.problem: This error indicates a structural problem with the font. Structural errors may be caused by: a font tool incorrectly generating the font file; a person altering the contents of a valid font file; or some other corruption to the font file. Regenerate the font, or contact the font vendor to obtain a valid version of the font.

item.shortDesc: The version is not 0x00020000
item.problem: Version 0x00020000 is the only version of the EBLC table currently defined. Correct this field using a table editing tool.

item.shortDesc: The EBDT table is not present
item.problem: ERROR: Required field missing

item.shortDesc: Bitmap size table start index is larger than the end index value
item.problem: ERROR: Required field missing

item.shortDesc: The index subtable is not valid
item.problem: ERROR: Required field missing

item.shortDesc: The number of sizes requires more space than available in the EBLC table.
item.problem: ERROR: Required field missing

item.shortDesc: The table length does not equal the calculated value
item.problem: The table length does not correspond to the number of sizes (strikes) covered and the bitmapScaleTable required for each. Rebuild and add the bitmap tables using an embedded bitmap editing tool.

item.shortDesc: The version is not 0x00020000
item.problem: Version 0x00020000 is the only version of the EBSC table currently defined. Correct this field using a table editing tool or an embedded bitmap embedding tool that uses the correct version value.

item.shortDesc: Other required bitmap tables are not present
item.problem: ERROR: Required field missing

item.shortDesc: Could not verify substitute bitmap strikes because EBLC is not present
item.problem: ERROR: Required field missing

item.shortDesc: Substitute bitmap strike is not in font
item.problem: ERROR: Required field missing

item.shortDesc: Some rangeGaspBehavior fields contain invalid flags
item.problem: The four currently defined flags for rangeGaspBehavior include: GASP_DOGRAY (0x0002, use grayscale rendering); GASP_GRIDFIT (0x0001, use gridfitting); GASP_DOGRAY|GASP_GRIDFIT (0x0003, use both grayscale rendering and gridfitting); neither (0x0004). Correct the values using a table editing tool.

item.shortDesc: The gaspRange array does not have a 0xFFFF sentinel
item.problem: The last record should use 0xFFFF as a sentinel value for rangeMaxPPEM and should describe the behavior desired at all sizes larger than the previous record's upper limit. If the only entry in 'gasp' is the 0xFFFF sentinel value, the behavior described will be used for all sizes. Correct the gasp table using a table editing tool that builds the table properly.

item.shortDesc: The gaspRange array is not in sorted order
item.problem: The records in the gaspRange[] array must be sorted in order of increasing rangeMaxPPEM value. Correct the table using a table editor that builds the gasp table properly.

item.shortDesc: The version number is not valid
item.problem: Version 0 is the only version of the gasp table currently defined. Correct this field using a table editing tool.

item.shortDesc: Component's transform is ambigously defined
item.problem: When defining composite components of composite glyphs, bits 3 (WE_HAVE_A_SCALE), 6 (WE_HAVE_AN_X_AND_Y_SCALE), and 7 (WE_HAVE_A_TWO_BY_TWO) should be mutually exclusive. This error indicates that more than one of these bits is set.

item.shortDesc: An exception occurred during glyph validation or loading of one of its components
item.problem: This error indicates that the validating process for a specific glyph failed and the validation for that glyph has been stopped. Validation then continues on the next glyph. Please report this error to the Microsoft Typography group.

item.shortDesc: Unable to start validation of 'glyf' table
item.problem: The Font Validator will be unable to start glyph validation if one of the following conditions is present: unable to open the font file, unable to get font from file, missing glyf table, missing loca table, incorrect loca format, or incorrect number of loca entries.

item.shortDesc: The DeviceRecord padding bytes are not 0
item.problem: Each DeviceRecord must be padded with 0's to make it long word aligned. Use a tool such as Microsoft's CacheTT to recalculate and build this table.

item.shortDesc: There are duplicate DeviceRecords
item.problem: Use a tool such as Microsoft's CacheTT to recalculate and build this table.

item.shortDesc: The hdmx widths can't be validated due to an error while rasterizing the glyphs, likely a hinting instruction error
item.problem: Metrics affected by hints can only be validated at runtime. Therefore, this error is typically generated when the Font Validator uses the rasterizer to execute the hinting instructions contained in the font. The detail of this error message may or may not refer to the glyph that is associated with the bad hinting code, depending on how the overflow or other rasterizing error was encountered. For example, in the case of a stack overflow, the problem may be due to hinting instructions for a previous glyph not having been properly removed from the stack. To perform detailed checks of hinting instructions, select rasterization testing in the Font Validator, or use a tool such as Microsoft's Flint or VTT.

item.shortDesc: The SizeofDeviceRecord is not long aligned
item.problem: SizeofDeviceRecord is a LONG value and should be padded in order to be long aligned. Use a tool such as Microsoft's CacheTT to recalculate and build this table.

item.shortDesc: The SizeofDeviceRecord doesn't match the calculated value
item.problem: There is a discrepancy between the number of glyphs specified and the size of the DeviceRecord. Use a tool such as Microsoft's CacheTT to recalculate and build this table.

item.shortDesc: The DeviceRecords are not sorted in ascending order
item.problem: DeviceRecords in the hdmx table should be sorted by pixel size. Use a tool such as Microsoft's CacheTT to recalculate and build this table.

item.shortDesc: The version number is not 0
item.problem: Version 0 is the only version of the hdmx table currently defined. Use a tool such as Microsoft's CacheTT to recalculate and build this table.

item.shortDesc: The hdmx width doesn't match the calculated width
item.problem: The hdmx width (the pixel width of a glyph in ppem) does not match the value calculated by the current version of the rasterizer. These values may not match if glyphs have been updated but the hdmx table has not yet been recalculated (using a tool such as Microsoft's CacheTT). This problem may also occur if the hdmx table was generated using a previous version of the rasterizer, or another tool that performs the width calculations differently. To make the values match, use the latest version of CacheTT to calculate the cached values using the current rasterizer. However, you may not want to change these values if there are concerns about the way text in legacy documents might reflow.

item.shortDesc: The table length is incorrect
item.problem: ERROR: Required field missing

item.shortDesc: The number of device records is negative
item.problem: ERROR: Required field missing

item.shortDesc: The created time is not valid
item.problem: The time the font was created should be a 64-bit integer that equals the number of seconds since midnight, January 1, 1904. Use a table editing tool to correct this value.

item.shortDesc: Reserved bit 14 of the flags field is set
item.problem: Bit 14 of the flags field is reserved and should be set to 0. Use a table editing tool to correct this value.

item.shortDesc: Reserved bit 15 of the flags field is set
item.problem: Bit 15 of the flags field is reserved and should be set to 0. Use a table editing tool to correct this value.

item.shortDesc: Non-linear scaling flag (bit 4) is clear, but hdmx table is present
item.problem: Setting bit 4 of the flags field to clear indicates that the advance width of glyphs will scale linearly because hinting instructions will not alter the advance widths.. The presence of the hdmx table indicates that the advance width of glyphs within this font may be affected by hinting instructions. Set this bit to indicate that the advance widths might not scale linearly.

item.shortDesc: Non-linear scaling flag (bit 4) is clear, but LTSH table is present
item.problem: Setting bit 4 of the flags field to clear indicates that the advance width of glyphs will scale linearly because hinting instructions will not alter the advance widths. If this is so, then no LTSH table is needed in the font. The presence of the LTSH table indicates that the advance width of glyphs within this font may be affected by hinting instructions. Set this bit to indicate that the advance widths might not scale linearly.

item.shortDesc: Font checksum is incorrect
item.problem: This error indicates a structural problem with the font. Structural errors may be caused by: a font tool incorrectly generating the font file; a person altering the contents of a valid font file; or some other corruption to the font file. Regenerate the font, or contact the font vendor to obtain a valid version of the font.

item.shortDesc: The fontDirectionHint is not in the range -2..2
item.problem: Allowable settings for the fontDirectionHint field range from -2 to 2. Correct this value using a tool that builds valid head tables.

item.shortDesc: The glyphDataFormat value is not 0
item.problem: The only currently defined value for this field is 0. Correct this value using a tool that builds valid head tables.

item.shortDesc: The indexToLocFormat value does not match the loca table
item.problem: This value should be set to indicate which version, long or short, of the loca table is being used. A value of 0 indicates the loca table uses short offsets, a value of 1 indicates long offsets.

item.shortDesc: The indexToLocFormat value is not 0 or 1
item.problem: This value should be set to indicate which version, long or short, of the loca table is being used. A value of 0 indicates the loca table uses short offsets, a value of 1 indicates long offsets. Ensure that the tool you are using to edit this font is setting this value correctly.

item.shortDesc: The lowestRecPPEM value is zero
item.problem: This value should indicate the smallest size (in pixels) at which the font is readable. The lowestRecPPEM value should be an indicator of the level at which the font is hinted. Use a head table editor to correct this value.

item.shortDesc: The macStyle bold bit doesn't match the name table's font subfamily string
item.problem:
There is a discrepancy between the setting of the bold bit of the macStyle field and the Subfamily name field in the name table. There are several places within the font file that the typeface may be characterized as 'Regular,' 'Bold,' 'Italic,' 'Condensed,' etc. Font designers should encode this information consistently throughout the font. Font clients use the information to:
  • organize related typefaces into families (i.e., Arial Narrow, Arial, Arial Bold, Arial Expanded...)
  • use appropriate names when enumerating typefaces to the user
  • obtain a font from the system according to certain attributes (weight, style, width)
The fields related to encoding this information exist in several different tables:
  • In the name table, Name ID strings (family name, subfamily name, full-font name, preferred family grouping, and preferred subfamily grouping)
  • In the OS/2 table, usWeightClass, usWidthClass, PANOSE(tm), and fsSelection.
  • In the head table, macStyle bits
Correct this data using a table editing tool.
For examples of how to use these various fields, see these name string examples.

item.shortDesc: The macStyle bold bit is clear, but the OS/2 fsSelection bold bit is set
item.problem:
The setting of the macStyle bold bit indicates the font is not bold, but the fsSelection bits in the OS/2 table indicate the font is bold. The fsSelection bits are used over the macStyle bits in Windows.
There are several places within the font file that the typeface may be characterized as 'Regular,' 'Bold,' 'Italic,' 'Condensed,' etc. Font designers should encode this information consistently throughout the font. Font clients use the information to:
  • organize related typefaces into families (i.e., Arial Narrow, Arial, Arial Bold, Arial Expanded...)
  • use appropriate names when enumerating typefaces to the user
  • obtain a font from the system according to certain attributes (weight, style, width)
The fields related to encoding this information exist in several different tables:
  • In the name table, Name ID strings (family name, subfamily name, full-font name, preferred family grouping, and preferred subfamily grouping)
  • In the OS/2 table, usWeightClass, usWidthClass, PANOSE(tm), and fsSelection.
  • In the head table, macStyle bits
Correct this data using a table editing tool.
For examples of how to use these various fields, see these name string examples.

item.shortDesc: The macStyle bold bit is set, but the OS/2 fsSelection bold bit is clear
item.problem:
The setting of the macStyle bold bit indicates the font is bold, but the fsSelection field in the OS/2 table indicates the font is not bold. The fsSelection bits are used over the macStyle bits in Windows.

item.shortDesc: The macStyle italic bit doesn't match the name table's font subfamily string
item.problem:
There is a discrepancy between the setting of the italic bit of the macStyle field and the Subfamily name field in the name table. item.shortDesc: The macStyle italic bit is clear, but the OS/2 fsSelection italic bit is set
item.problem:
The setting of the macStyle italic bit indicates the font is not italic, but the fsSelection bits in the OS/2 table indicate the font is italic. The fsSelection bits are used over the macStyle bits in Windows.
There are several places within the font file that the typeface may be characterized as 'Regular,' 'Bold,' 'Italic,' 'Condensed,' etc. Font designers should encode this information consistently throughout the font. Font clients use the information to:

item.shortDesc: The macStyle italic bit is clear, but the post table italic angle is nonzero
item.problem: The setting of the macStyle italic bit indicates the font is not italic, but the italicAngle field in the post table suggests the font is slanted. Correct these encodings using a table editing tool.

item.shortDesc: The macStyle italic bit is set, but the OS/2 fsSelection italic bit is clear
item.problem:
The setting of the macStyle italic bit indicates the font is italic, but the fsSelection bits in the OS/2 table indicate the font is not italic. The fsSelection bits are used over the macStyle bits in Windows.
There are several places within the font file that the typeface may be characterized as 'Regular,' 'Bold,' 'Italic,' 'Condensed,' etc. Font designers should encode this information consistently throughout the font. Font clients use the information to:
  • organize related typefaces into families (i.e., Arial Narrow, Arial, Arial Bold, Arial Expanded...)
